Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can show a drawing of a plant with plenty of water and a plant without water.
The student can illustrate how a plant looks healthy with water (e.g., green leaves, standing upright).
The student can illustrate how a plant looks unhealthy without water (e.g., brown leaves, wilting).
The student can make observations of plant changes over time with and without water.
The student can identify and draw patterns they observe, like differences in plant growth with water and without water.
The student can use their drawing to explain why water is important for plant life.
